Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

issue.title: New embed_options to select the default theme or unset the theme setting

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

I want a new `embed_options` that sets the theme as the default one, or removes the theme setting saved in Local Storage.

### Why?

Once you embed a Streamlit app with `embed_options=light_theme` or `embed_options=dark_theme`,
the theme of the app is set to light or dark and its config is saved in the browser's Local Storage.
So, when you introduce a custom theme in the app and want to switch the theme of the embedded app to it, there is no way to invalidate the saved light or dark theme setting for the users who have already visited the page, so you can't show the custom theme to them by default.


### How?

_No response_

### Additional Context

This issue is based on a similar motivation to #7118.

body: Marking this as a bug since it's something we should have fixed in the first place. If the app has a custom theme, it should take priority over `?embed_options`. @whitphx if we fix this, I assume you wouldn't necessarily need #7117 anymore?

> if we fix this, I assume you wouldn't necessarily need #7117 anymore?

50% yes. The original problem I had will be solved by this issue.

#7117 still has a question whether there should be a new `embed_options` to unset the theme setting saved in Local Storage and restore the "Use system setting" theme even when the app doesn't have a custom theme.

Let me just dump my random thoughts about it: In the setting dialog, all these 4 theme configs are in the same select box. So I expected all these 4 configs are "at the same level" or "have the same priority," and each item is just there to be selected by the user with the same weight. However, in the `embed_options` API, * Only the "Light" and "Dark" theme are selectable. * (If this issue is fixed in a way you said,) the "Custom Theme" config will have a special priority among these. So I feel things look inconsistent, i.e. the behavior looks confusing. Probably, this sense can support the motivation of #5134. It suggests customizing the color values of the "Light" and "Dark" themes, instead of adding a new "Custom Theme", which doesn't introduce this kind of uneven priorities among the theme settings. --- From another perspective, the problem maybe `embed_options=*_theme` saves the theme on Local Storage. Due to this behavior, I assumed this option is emulating user's theme selection on the dialog, though it is not consistent in that these are not `embed_options` values for "Custom Theme" and "Use system settings". It might be clear enough if `embed_options` doesn't affect Local Storage and is only responsible for "setting the initial theme selection when appropriate = when custom config is not set," in addition to making the custom theme most priority as you wrote.

issue.title: HuggingFace Space not respecting Streamlit configuration settings

repository.name: hub-docs
repository.description: Docs of the Hugging Face Hub

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

My Streamlit HuggingFace Space is not respecting the Streamlit configuration settings I have defined in `.streamlit/config.toml`. Specifically, the app color settings as defined in the `toml` file are not being used in the deployed app. These settings work when running my application locally, so it appears to be a problem with the HF Space deployment.

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### System info

```shell
{'huggingface_hub version': '0.14.1',
 'Platform': 'macOS-13.1-arm64-arm-64bit',
 'Python version': '3.10.11',
 'Running in iPython ?': 'Yes',
 'iPython shell': 'ZMQInteractiveShell',
 'Running in notebook ?': 'Yes',
 'Running in Google Colab ?': 'No',
 'Has saved token ?': True,
 'Configured git credential helpers': 'osxkeychain',
 'FastAI': 'N/A',
 'Tensorflow': 'N/A',
 'Torch': '2.0.0',
 'Jinja2': '3.1.2',
 'Graphviz': 'N/A',
 'Pydot': '1.4.2',
 'Pillow': '9.5.0',
 'hf_transfer': 'N/A',
 'gradio': 'N/A',
 'ENDPOINT': 'https://huggingface.co',
 'HF_HUB_OFFLINE': False,
 'HF_HUB_DISABLE_TELEMETRY': False,
 'HF_HUB_DISABLE_PROGRESS_BARS': None,
 'HF_HUB_DISABLE_SYMLINKS_WARNING': False,
 'HF_HUB_DISABLE_EXPERIMENTAL_WARNING': False,
 'HF_HUB_DISABLE_IMPLICIT_TOKEN': False,
 'HF_HUB_ENABLE_HF_TRANSFER': False}
```
```

body:
We were discussing and agree this one would be good to fix soon and I'm good to just change the default priority so that custom base theme overrides light and dark mode setting in embed.

BTW I think eventually we should support custom light vs dark theme as in #5134 - in that case, it would just be applied based on the embed_options setting. But a custom base theme would still override all (presumably). If there's a problem with this default behavior, we could add a new `embed_option` to turn it off somehow. But I'm not sure it's needed.

issue.title: Allow custom themes to override embed options query parameter

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

We set the theme based on the query param each time the script run is finished. This can break other theme settings, so we want to respect the query parameters only on initial load (in determining the default theme.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #7118 

## Testing Plan

- Updated JS Unit Tests for the default theme. There were no tests for the script finished action, so I did not include tests for the removal.

---

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.
